text: Narito Namizato (born August 7, 1989) is a Japanese professional basketball player for Ryukyu Golden Kings of the B.League.In 2008 Namizato won the "Slam Dunk Scholarship" funded by Takehiko Inoue, and played in America. He is one of the league-leading premier passers. ==Basketball shoes== He prefers sturdy materials and hard rubber for basketball shoes (Asics).https://basketballking.jp/news/japan/20180426/61195.html ==Personal== His brother Tasuku plays for the Kumamoto Volters of the B.League. ==Career statistics== |- | style="background-color:#afe6ba" align="left" | 2009-10 | align="left" | Tochigi | 18 || 0 || 4.9 || 43.3 || 0.0 || 66.7 || 0.7 || 0.7 || 0.1 || 0.0 || 2.3 |- | align="left" | 2010-11 | align="left" | Tochigi | 10 || 0 || 7.4 || 30.8 || 14.3 || 44.4 || 0.8 || 1.0 || 0.1 || 0.0 || 2.1 |- | style="background-color:#afe6ba" align="left" | 2011-12 | align="left" | Ryukyu | 52 || 40 || 27.2 || 41.7 || 30.4 || 64.2 || 4.1 || 4.2 || 1.2 || 0.1 || 11.0 |- | align="left" | 2012-13 | align="left" | Ryukyu | 50 || 49 || 29.0 || 37.8 || 26.7 || 72.3 || 4.8 || 6.2 || 1.5 || 0.1 || 11.5 |- | style="background-color:#afe6ba" align="left" | 2013-14 | align="left" | Ryukyu | 16 || 0 || 20.2 || 29.7 || 28.6 || 70.0 || 2.4 || 2.9 || 1.0 || 0.1 || 5.0 |- | align="left" | 2014-15 | align="left" | Ryukyu | 52 || 3 || 21.7 || 38.4 || 33.3 || 74.1 || 3.1 || 3.0 || 0.8 || 0.1 || 7.8 |- | align="left" | 2015-16 | align="left" | Osaka | 52 || 25 || 24.6 || 39.5 || 25.6 || 70.9 || 3.2 || 4.3 || 1.3 || 0.1 || 8.0 |- | align="left" | 2016-17 | align="left" | Shiga |46 || 32 ||25.0 || 37.9||27.1 ||70.4 || 3.5 || 4.2 ||1.0 ||0.1 ||9.9 |- | align="left" | 2017-18 | align="left" | Shiga |59 || 59 ||27.9 || 40.0||29.0 ||79.1 || 3.2 || 7.4 ||1.5 ||0.0 ||12.2 |- | align="left" | 2018-19 | align="left" | Ryukyu |57 || 49 ||23.0 || 45.3||23.5||78.4 || 2.5 || 6.4 ||0.9 ||0.1 ||8.9 |- ==References== == External links == *RealGM profile * * Category:1989 births Category:Living people Category:Utsunomiya Brex players Category:Osaka Evessa players Category:Ryukyu Golden Kings players Category:Shiga Lakestars players Category:South Kent School alumni
